intro: Malvaviscus mollis, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, cottony seeds. Malvaviscus mollis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
